message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about the characteristics of arid air. As the air becomes more arid, it means that there is a decrease in moisture content. Therefore, the air contains less humidity. Option (A) is incorrect because oxygen is present in the air regardless of its humidity. Option (B) is incorrect because arid air typically has low moisture content, so it is unlikely to contain rain. Option (D) is incorrect because the presence of static electricity is not directly related to the humidity of the air.

Option (D) is unrelated to the moisture content of the air.
